jobs.title: Growth Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Lindy

We're on a mission to free humanity from work. What if your AI teammate could manage your inbox, run your calendar, manage your meetings, communicate with clients, and close deals?

As crazy as it sounds, humanity has already freed itself once — from hard, menial work. We’re just finishing the job, using AI agents to automate all knowledge work.

Our goal is to build AI employees that can collaborate with humans and other AI employees across all channels (email, Slack, Zoom, phone calls, etc), pursue ambiguous goals in dynamic contexts, and continuously learn from their experience.

As grandiloquent or exceedingly ambitious as it may sound, we point out that:

  1. It is in line with previous large scale, technology-driven waves of automation that have happened. As recently as in 1900, about 35% of Western Europe’s population was employed in farming — about the same as the percent of the US population currently engaged in knowledge work. Today, this number has fallen to less than 4%.

  2. There is a clear roadmap to get there: it has become evident that large language models are good not only to generate text, but also to process large amounts of information, and take action based on it, across various systems, in pursuit of a goal. In short: the AI employee is in sight.

The current incarnation of our product lets you create these “AI agents” via a simple text prompt in order to automate workflows of low-to-medium complexity, used by our customers to massively increase their efficiency across functions ranging from marketing to sales, customer support, personal assistance, and more.

Our Culture

Lindy’s Culture

At Lindy, you can expect an environment with little process and high empowerment, paired with high expectations and a strong sense of urgency.

We are an in-office company, working from our downtown San Francisco office 4+ days a week. We sponsor visas and cover relocation costs up to $20,000.

The Role

As our Growth Product Manager, you will own and optimize our product-led growth funnel from acquisition all the way through activation and retention, with data-driven experimentation and product innovation.

You should have a strong point of view of how to leverage in and out of product experiences, data, and experimentation to drive meaningful and measurable results.

Key Responsibilities

  • Identify opportunities to drive growth across acquisition, onboarding, activation, retention, monetization, and referrals.

  • Dive deep into analytics to understand user behavior, segment audiences, and uncover growth levers. Build dashboards and frameworks to track performance and guide decision-making.

  • Design, prioritize, and execute A/B tests and growth experiments. Analyze results to extract insights and scale winning initiatives.

  • Partner with Engineering, Design, and GTM to build and launch growth features (e.g., templates, viral loops, marketplaces, usage incentives).

Who You Are

  • Experience in growth, product management, product marketing, or analytics.

  • Strong analytical skills with experience using SQL, analytics tools (Amplitude, Mixpanel, etc.), and running rigorous experiments. You should be part data analyst, part marketer, and part PM

  • Comfortable with ambiguity and moving fast. You find creative solutions with limited resources and aren't afraid to get your hands dirty.

  • Highly organized and methodical. You effectively maintain and prioritize experiment backlogs and tracking systems that keep fast-moving initiatives on schedule while ensuring transparency with dependent stakeholders.

  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills

Bonus Qualifications

  • Proven track record in high-growth startup environments

  • Experience at AI/ML companies or with usage-based pricing models

  • Experience with no-code or workflow automation tools (Zapier, Make.com, etc)

Compensation and Benefits

  • Base Salary Range $200-260K + equity

  • Comprehensive health coverage

  • $20K relocation assistance and visa sponsorship

  • High autonomy and direct collaboration with leadership

Location

San Francisco office (downtown)

jobs.title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Lindy

We're on a mission to free humanity from work. What if your AI teammate could manage your inbox, run your calendar, manage your meetings, communicate with clients, and close deals?

As crazy as it sounds, humanity has already freed itself once — from hard, menial work. We’re just finishing the job, using AI agents to automate all knowledge work.

Our goal is to build AI employees that can collaborate with humans and other AI employees across all channels (email, Slack, Zoom, phone calls, etc), pursue ambiguous goals in dynamic contexts, and continuously learn from their experience.

The Role

As the Executive Assistant to the CEO at Lindy, you will provide comprehensive administrative support to the founder, own calendar management, lead company onboarding, and coordinate with external contractors and agencies. This role requires exceptional organization, proactive problem-solving, and the ability to thrive in an ambiguous dynamic startup culture.

We are an in-office company and this role will require in-office presence 5 days a week.

Who You Are

  • Manage and prioritize the founder’s calendar, appointments, and meeting logistics, ensuring optimal time allocation and preparation for all engagements

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for scheduling, both internally and externally, and handle all communications regarding the founder’s availability

  • Handle confidential information with the utmost discretion and professionalism

  • Assist with travel arrangements, expense reporting, and ad hoc personal tasks as needed

  • Maintain digital organizational systems (e.g., G-Suite, Notion, Slack) to streamline workflows and documentation

  • World-class written communication skills

  • Ability to operate with high ambiguity

  • Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks without anything falling through the cracks

  • Deep attention to detail

  • Resourcefulness, agency and ability to “figure it out”

  • Strong work ethic

  • Stellar collaboration skills

Responsibilities

  • Process and triage email

  • Keep the CEO advised of time-sensitive matters

  • Help manage the CEO’s calendar in conjunction with his Lindy AI Agent, and help him audit his time

  • Oversee the end-to-end onboarding process for new hires, including preparing materials, ordering equipment, and ensuring a smooth integration into the company

  • Coordinate travel arrangements for CEO and potential candidates

  • Partner with Recruiting to collaborate the CEO’s calendar and interviews

  • Manage Accounts Payable with the support of the company accountants

  • Managing software permissions (e.g. granting access to teammates)

  • Go-to resource for employee needs as pertains to HR, Immigration and other day to day needs

  • Additional tasks as needed

Requirements

  • 3-5+ years of experience as an Executive Assistant, ideally in a startup or high-growth environment working for C-suite level executives

  • Proven expertise in calendar management and executive support, with the ability to anticipate needs and proactively resolve scheduling conflicts

  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail; able to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced setting

  • Experience managing onboarding processes and working with HR or operations teams

  • High level of discretion, trustworthiness, and emotional intelligence

  • Tech-savvy, with proficiency in G-Suite, Notion, Slack, and other productivity tools

  • Flexible and adaptable, willing to work outside standard business hours as needed

  • Ability to work in person 5 days a week from a San Francisco office

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and generous equity

  • Health coverage

  • Subsidized lunch program

  • The fun of working at a no-nonsense startup that just wants to build an amazing product and business

Compensation

  • Salary Range: 110K to 160K OTE

jobs.title: Engineering Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Lindy

We're on a mission to free humanity from work. What if your AI teammate could manage your inbox, run your calendar, manage your meetings, communicate with clients, and close deals?

As crazy as it sounds, humanity has already freed itself once — from hard, menial work. We’re just finishing the job, using AI agents to automate all knowledge work.

Our goal is to build AI employees that can collaborate with humans and other AI employees across all channels (email, Slack, Zoom, phone calls, etc), pursue ambiguous goals in dynamic contexts, and continuously learn from their experience.

The Role

As an Engineering Manager at Lindy, you’ll lead three core engineering teams: Application Experience, Growth, and Integrations. These teams are at the heart of how customers experience Lindy, how we expand adoption, and how we connect with the broader ecosystem.

You’ll own the roadmap end-to-end: scoping projects, sequencing milestones, unblocking engineers, and making sure we ship features that delight customers with urgency and velocity. You’ll triage issues, make smart trade-offs between speed and long-term quality, and keep projects moving fast.

This isn’t a heavyweight process role. You’ll be embedded in a small, lean, and focused team, working directly with product, design, and Lindy’s Head of Engineering and CEO to keep momentum high. You’ll debug both systems and people, cut scope when needed, and push projects across the finish line. Most importantly, you’ll grow and motivate a team of engineers while keeping them tightly connected to the product and to our customers.

Read our Culture Doc

Read our public Engineering Standard of Excellence

We are an in-office company, working from our San Francisco office 4 days a week. We do sponsor visas and cover relocation fees for up to $20,000.

Who You Are

  • 7+ years of total engineering experience, including time as an IC

  • 2+ years of management experience, managing a team of at least 4 engineers

  • Work with urgency to build critical features with a keen attention to detail and polish

  • Proven ability to ship product in fast-paced startup environments

  • A technical and product-oriented leader: deeply connected to customer experience, bug reports, feedback loops, and eager to get into the details of what you own

  • Excellent at sequencing, trade-offs, and scoping

  • Strong communication skills: clear, concise, and direct

  • Enthusiastic and optimistic by nature; problems are challenges, not reasons for cynicism

  • Comfortable giving and receiving tough feedback, including managing people out if necessary

  • Able to work in person 4 days a week from our San Francisco office

Bonus Skills

  • Prior experience as a Tech Lead Manager in a startup environment

  • Hands-on technical background across frontend and backend systems

  • Experience with sprint planning, project roadmaps, and milestone tracking in a lightweight process environment

  • Prior exposure to AI/LLM-powered products or integrations

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and generous equity

  • Health coverage

  • A lot of autonomy within your area of responsibility

  • The fun of working at a no-nonsense startup that just wants to build an amazing product and business

  • Covered in-office lunch + dinner

Compensation

Salary Range: $180K to $250K Base

jobs.title: Head of Sales
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Lindy

We're on a mission to free humanity from work. What if your AI teammate could manage your inbox, run your calendar, manage your meetings, communicate with clients, and close deals?

As crazy as it sounds, humanity has already freed itself once — from hard, menial work. We’re just finishing the job, using AI agents to automate all knowledge work.

Our goal is to build AI employees that can collaborate with humans and other AI employees across all channels (email, Slack, Zoom, phone calls, etc), pursue ambiguous goals in dynamic contexts, and continuously learn from their experience.

The Role

As Head of Sales at Lindy, you will scale our sales organization while actively contributing to revenue growth through direct selling in the beginning of your tenure.

You will build the systems and playbooks to capture the massive Mid-Market opportunity in AI agents. You'll work closely with marketing to refine our go-to-market strategy and with product to ensure we're building what customers need.

Read our Culture Doc

We are an in-office company, working from our San Francisco office 4 days a week. We do sponsor visas and cover relocation fees for up to $20,000.

Key Responsibilities

  • Drive revenue growth through direct selling while leading and coaching the sales team

  • Build and scale the sales organization, including hiring, training, and developing AEs

  • Develop and refine sales systems and playbooks

  • Collaborate with marketing on lead generation and qualification processes

  • Partner with product and be the “voice of the customer” across the company

  • Establish compensation plans and territory strategies

  • Build relationships with key customers and partners

Who You Are

  • 5+ years of B2B SaaS sales experience with consistent quota achievement

  • 2+ years of sales team leadership experience

  • Proven track record selling to Mid-Market customers

  • Strong analytical skills and data-driven approach to sales management

  • Excellent sales forecasting and pipeline management skills

  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills

  • Ability to work in person 4 days a week from a San Francisco office

Bonus Skills

  • Experience selling no-code or workflow automation solutions

  • Background in AI/ML products

  • Experience in high-growth startup environments

  • Track record of successful partnership with product and marketing teams

  • Experience with sales tools and automation platforms

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and generous equity

  • Health coverage

  • Covered in-office lunch + dinner

  • A lot of autonomy within your area of responsibility

  • The fun of working at a no-nonsense startup that just wants to build an amazing product and business

Compensation

  • Salary Range 300K to 400K OTE
